experience: You and Sean both know Jaime Casap, Michael Ellenby, and 10 others
One day sustainable, regenerative - and likely robotic -
agriculture will be..our species literal lifeline. Leaders in finance and politics who recognize this deserve a salute.

At Bitwater, I'm responsible for building the foundation of business development, growth and team-building.  I also play an active role in product design and get my hands dirty in farm work from time to time.

Worked with high-growth startups in LA.  Two of Fast Co's Top 10 in LA.  Ad tech and media tech.  Designed algorithms for cross-channel marketing analysis, large-scale audience engagement and automated marketing.

The company developed a system to bring the discipline of “Social Network Analysis” (SNA) to the enterprise financial services segment.  Sean co-founded the company and led business development, marketing and sales.  He also played a prominent, sometimes leading role in software design.  The company raised angel investment and won the prestigious NC IDEA venture capital award in North Carolina.  The company grew from “two guys in a garage” to serving large clients in target market and successfully executing on Phase 1 of a Fortune 500 partnership.
University of North Carolina at Asheville
Founder of Nucleus Student Organization, President of Student Organization Council, Student Leader of the Year, Faculty Senate Committee on Tuition
Sean's undergraduate research project on the development (and lack thereof) of an HIV vaccine was presented at the National Undergraduate Research Symposium in 2004.
Served in a variety of roles, as advisor and co-creative director for a HATCH MT event in 2014
Served in a variety of roles, as advisor and co-creative director for a HATCH MT event in 2014
recommendations: Kasem Mohsen
President & COO at ADEPTCentral
January 15, 2012, Sean was a client of Kasem’s

I had the pleasure of partnering with Sean on some social network analysis initiatives and was consistently amazed by his ability to provide insight into very complex concepts in a way that even a novice can understand. His gift at creating interesting and enlightening visualizations from troves of common social data is both invaluable and a revelation into how businesses must successfully leverage the theories of social network analysis in order to effectively compete in the market of tomorrow. I would not hesitate to get on a ship where Sean is at the helm. When the inevitable wave sweeps us all into the economy of the future, Sean's unique skill set will become indispensable for any organization looking to understand the impact of their relationships in a rapidly shrinking world.

Maggie Ullman
Principal at Ullman Consulting
September 17, 2012, Sean and Maggie were students together

Maggie Ullman has always been - and will always be - a rockstar.  Even in college, she was, as a student leader, an exceptional person.  She is tireless and fearless in her work and truly passionate about pragmatic actions that protect the earth.  I would recommend to anybody who wants to be the change they wish to see in the world that they, at the very least, talk to Maggie.  If you're lucky, you might get to work with her on a project.

Senior Sound Designer / Mixer at Beacon Street Studios
September 17, 2012, Sean worked with Amber but at different companies

I worked with Amber as a part of HATCHfest and on an art project (soon to be a product) called The Reality Inspector.  She is a talented composer and a true professional.  I was amazed at how she brought my vision for a soundtrack for an art installation to life.  I described something "OK" that "would work" and she over-delivered with something AMAZING.

summary: At Bitwater, we build large-scale insect farming equipment.  As CEO of an ag-tech and insect farming company, I lead business development and investor relations.  I enjoy building products that synthesize data-driven technologies - and now, AI - with the real world.
name: Sean McDonald
title: CEO at Bitwater--Building Insect Infrastructure
